titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: Old South Baton Rouge Churches
titleInfo.subTitle: Jasmine McKnight oral history interview, 1997

name.description: Jasmine McKnight was born March 23, 1982, in Baton Rouge, La. She attended McKinley High School, and later Southern University where she was on the Gold'n Bluez Dance Team from 2000 to 2002. She graduated with a bachelor's degree in marketing in 2005.

subject.topic: Magnolia Southern Baptist Church (Baton Rouge, La.)
African American young women--Religious life--Louisiana--Baton Rouge.
Church work with African American youth--Louisiana--Baton Rouge.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: McKnight, a high school student, describes her experiences and beliefs as a devoted member of Magnolia Southern Baptist Church in Baton Rouge. She discusses her baptism, participation in church youth activities, and service in the community. She describes a typical church service, church outreach activities and prominent parishioners and pastors. She also touches on peer pressure and drug use among her peers, and her efforts to live in accordance with Christian teachings.
